result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan M Shively was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Religious Property [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.012(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$250 bail in case 14CF40 transferred to this case and applied toward restitution. Balance of restitution due during period of supervision.
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Court costs due during period of supervision.
Pay supervision fees.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Defendant to submit to random testing

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant Nathan M Shively in court with attorney Rachel M Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Waive reading of felony complaint.  State requests $5000 cash bail with no contact conditions. Public defender will reappoint counsel. Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint. Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.
